segment.text: The apartment was nice, for its size.
crammed with hundreds of volumes, files, and notebooks.
A few small crates had been converted into a filing system of some sort,
filled to the brim with papers, clippings, and who knows what else.
A nearby table was cluttered with pages of scribbled diagrams and figures, alongside contraption of a singular sort.
A mismatched set of chairs sat facing a small fireplace.
A harmonica sat glinting on the mantlepiece.
but still studying me intently with those penetrating brown eyes.
“Your bedroom’s down on the far right, in the corner.
“Well, I suggest you move them inside;
The ease with which she picked up two of my jammed suitcases nearly put me to shame.
No one called me Marie anymore.
My mum was the only person to-
the voice was coming from behind me.
I shivered, sure something was crawling up my spine.
I felt a hand grab my shoulder, and then suddenly-
rubbing my eyes with the palms of my hands.
I had a right to be tired.
I had just traveled about two hundred and sixty miles, for approximately four and a half hours across the bottom of New Hampshire, through Massachusetts, Connecticut, part of Pennsylvania
and now finally I was arriving in New Jersey.
I almost considered going back to sleep,
I had to get off soon.
Wait, why should I get off?
“I trust you had a safe flight, dismal
Not only was the dust on your shoes suggestive,
but you smell faintly of jet fuel & inferior peanuts.
That, & your boarding pass is sticking out of your pocket with the airline’s name facing out.”
She studied me intently once more.
I’d have to get used to that.
have been walking a great deal as of late;
I nearly fell out of my chair.
“Not many ‘lower’ people, including myself, going around wearing a Rolex like that.
your shoes have been worn a few milimeters,
but the canvas is fairly new.
As far as the writing goes, you’ve a considerable amout of ink & graphite on the side of your left hand.”
A girl, sixteen years old, with masses of bright red hair and big gray eyes opened the door.
I walked up the pathway and into Beth’s mansion of a house,
Was I ever going to get over being around her?
Beth pointed down the stairs, to where the music was blasting from.
I strode over to the opening.
I looked back over my shoulder,
but Beth was already on the couch, absorbed with a cute junior.
I sighed, out loud this time.
I couldn’t wait to just let go.
I was always the life of the party after a few beers.
Plus, I didn’t feel any pain of any sort
when I was at these loud parties.
I found serenity in the booming music.
I was floating on a cloud.
There was nothing under me, nothing over me, and nothing around me.
I didn’t want it to stop.
hard, I had already read the book,
and so I just jotted down a few notes for him.
sitting there, side by side on the couch.
pushing my hands through his hair, his hands all over me.
He pushed his hand under the edge of my shirt,
until his cool hands touched my chest.
and pulled me back down on top of him.
He kissed my sloppily on my neck,
as I tried to throw myself off him.
I just needed to get away.
“Good,” came a disembodied voice from deep in several shadows at once.
I tried to take better stock of the situation.
Brian was conscious but totally out of it, the poor guy.
His technical expertise had been invaluable in the past weeks,
but he just didn’t have the stomach for the rough stuff.
what we want,” interrupted the voice, booming and echoing through the stark environment of the industrial complex.
It had seemed like such a great base of operations at the time.
“Yeah, sure,” I tossed back into the shadows carelessly,
If only I could keep them talking long enough
for Evelyn to wake up, then she might...well, she might...
you expect me to just hand it over?”
We had a lot of devices.
The group started to get up, walking to their cars
that awaited them in the parking lot.
One by one, they got up from their spot on the sandallowing
their eyes to leave the fire,
letting it burn out by itself.
Two people were left, in their winter coats and denim jeans,
Only three cars were left in the lot.
wiping the sand from their legs.
The walked off the beach together,
as the last car pulled away.
The boy walked the girl to her car.
she looked into his dark blue eyes,
He jumped in his own car
As he turned away from the beach,
he saw the last flame of the fire,
what used to be so huge
they wouldn’t be able to put it out,
The group started to get up, walking to their cars
that awaited them in the parking lot.
One by one, they got up from
their spot on the sandallowing their eyes to leave the fire,
letting it burn out by itself.
their winter coats and denim jeans, sitting,
...Only three cars were left in the lot.
wiping the sand from their legs.
as the last car pulled away.
The boy walked the girl to her car.
she looked into his dark blue eyes,
his own car and turned the engine on.
As he turned away from the beach,
he saw the last flame of the fire,
they wouldn’t be able to put it out,
with dark bags under them, testifying her
"I should be doing my God damn English homework."
looking for where she left her
pen and paper before her breakdown interlude.
"You should be sleeping,” you tell her,
You let your finger tips play across her features,
traveling from tear stained cheeks up to heavy
"A little," you respond with a grin.
"No wonder I see six of you,"
I’ve somehow managed to write 225 ficlets, to me it’s amazing.
To thoses of you that have written 3, 4 and 500 ficlets or more
However, I’ll throw out a Challenge.
so few writers I didn’t pick a winner.
Maybe this one will do better.
The Challenge is to write a sequel to another writers ficlet.
But, not to anyone you have sequeled before,
and it has to be a ficlet
Enclude the original ficlet name in your sequel.
I will pick a winner on Nov. 27th (my birthday)
Prose of Priscilla, Poetry of Paralee
If middle school was a kingdom,
then Priscilla would surely be the queen.
She was tall, graceful, pretty, and interacted well with people.
Priscilla was adored by the teachers,
and refrained from malicious acts of meaness most of the time,
she still had a slice of vanity in her essence.
She didn’t quite fancy the idea of spending time
with anyone deemed unpopular or stupid.
Occasionally, she would volunteer her time for charity,
but she didn’t work the hardest.
Yet whenever she did even the slightest good deed,
a newspaper reporter always happened to be around.
Despite the fact that she was deemed an intelligent beauty by many, and as much
as she was one, the amazing truth still stood.
she wasn’t the greatest, or the purest, prettiest, or bravest.
who was all of this and so much more.
Contoured metallic parts glided and folded out over me,
and pushing me back in with them.
as I was suddenly plunged into darkness.
claustrophobia rampaging in my stomach like a terrified bull.
struggling like crazy to get free.
A voice, genderless and robotic, suddenly filled my head.
A sharp blade of light blinded me for a split second,
then moved down the rest of my body.
I was totally encased in metal.
The bar of blue light retracted into the front of my shell,
I was being shot to the top of the building, racing through its walls.
It was all one gigantic machine.
I was very, very high up.
followed by a cloud of perfume and a burst of autumn air.
reaching across the center console to wrap her arms around your neck.
Her blonde curls tickle at your face
and you smile into her neck.
In reality, you saw her two weeks ago,
You needed this- orange leaves and winding roads, the sound of her voice and the radio humming softly in the back of the car.
as the two of you chat endlessly.
She laughs at your drunken tales
and you roll your eyes at the boys
they are lucky to have her around.
that she does not have to look very far....
Mable was the prettiest soiled dove at the Longhorn,
so naturally Archie wanted to see
but lookin’ at her bloomers was free.
and slowly and carefully, followed Wilber down the alley.
They had to maneuver around the small pile of broken rail pieces.
and pointed to the landings broken rail,”Someone aught a fix
they could see some lacy undies
Indeed, the colorful undies were a sight to behold.
There were six pairs of panties, pink, red, black, purple, white with frilly lace and yellow.
“Archie, let’s steal us a pair,” Wilber said
as he overturned an empty whiskey barrel,
and yanked two pairs of panties from the line.
“Here Archie, stick these in your pocket.”
Then a voice called out, “Stop Thief!”
It is one thing to see,
it is another entirely to deduce.
in deductions, must not be afraid of being wrong.”
But one always must first observe & gather the facts,
Going in the other direction always bends facts to theories,
Her face scrunched at the very thought.
but an odd, siren noise rang out.
I like to keep my mind busy with small problems,
& people will come to me for advice.”
“I’m not associated with the official police.
She turned back to her phone.
“Ah yes, someone’s on his way over.”
“I should probably not intrude...” I started to get up.
If anything you’ll be a help!
But no matter now, because here comes our client.”
I am looking into the eyes of my friend.
The one thing that cheers me up when I am sad.
The thing I will love until the end.
A maniacal laugh seemed so clichÃ©,
but that is exactly what Cesar did as he stood before Millicent and her children,
holding their kitten in his beefy hands.
"One twist is all it will take,
Their mother looked with contempt upon the loathsome slime bag
The kitten would have to die
He would threaten the girls next,
"Lady, your hubby saw me kill that last girl in the park.
I simply cannot allow that to happen.
I will snap your daughters necks like little twigs,"
as he broke the neck of the kitten,
and went slack in his calloused hands.
He picked up the youngest child by the scruff of her neck
I was awaiting the pit of my stomach to return.
Lining up angry wasps would’ve been easier.
what was in store for me.
What the heck did that mean?
Was I going to be turned inside out?
Was I going to be brainwashed?
This felt like a science project
Get a hold of yourself, Carter!
one of my many internal voices yelled.
You wanna keep your wits about you
if they try to pull a fast one on you.
You’ve made it three days, right?
You can survive now, just keep it together, man!
I nodded resolutely to no one in particular.
But how was I going to keep it together?
I began murmuring under my breath, “Always look on the bright side of life.
I didn’t have too long to perk myself up.
An awkward silence filled the air,
I can make other things move,
'Oh' seemed to be his response to many things.
why I was even talking to him,
why I'd even talked to him in the first place.
I didn't really have a reason.
Maybe we did have a connection,
Before today, I hadn't even known
other people could do things like this.
How many more people out there had these ‘abilities’?
If there was us, there were more.
I didn’t really know Andrew Gail,
and I guess I never will.
We went to elementary school together, actually.
he was kind of a jock, a student-council type, and that’s not really my scene,
not like I wanted him to die.
Did I ever talk to him?
I think we worked on a project together once.
who plays piano for the choir concerts,
who the school practically made their poster child.
We weren’t exactly of the same world.
the poor guy got caught up in the high school experience.
Who could’ve seen it coming, though?
Andrew Gail goes home one Friday night after the football game and blows his head off.
That’s one hell of a twist.
When you return to the city one boring train ride later,
The greyness if overwhelming; you should have known
you would experience withdrawls from the color of home.
You run to Starbucks to grab a Pumpkin Spice latte before delving into piles of schoolwork.
Your roommate drags you from the room after what feels like an eternity with promises of “booze and boobs.”
your term paper is not moving any further tonight.
One drink too many finds you
fumbling around in the dark with the leggy brunette from three floors up.
In the blackness that is her dorm room,
all you can see is the whites of her eyes.
Your mind flits to the blonde;
she is most likely sleeping at this hour.
You should be sleeping too, but you’re too busy
trying to find the colors of the city.
You wake to another grey morning.
Nothing matches the color of home.
"So are they going to fix it?"
people on Earth are interested in my ability..
and they might be able to fix it."
and I didn't have to hold myself down anymore.
Things are going to be different for me, but nothing bad."
the voice was going to get annoying after a while.
"Hey, um, do you want me to show you the way?"
so that now, I could walk without floating up into the air.
how they could create gravity in a spaceship.
Sophomore year, we were the only ones
He helped me out with Spanish and stuff.
it’s kind of weird to talk about him.
None of the guys thought anything was wrong.
sometimes he would get all deep and stuff,
But, you know, we’d get a can of beer in him
and go hang out with everyone else and then
and now we can’t do anything about it.
A vast domed room slid into view
as the doors of my pod retracted.
My restraints unlatched and popped me out,
sending me sprawling on the marble floor.
I was in the very top room of the tower, almost one hundred-fifty floors from the ground.
showing me absolutely terrifying views of the rest of the city.
To the left was the Sears Tower,
that looked more like the size of my arm from this height.
To the right was the Main Control building,
where the computers where maintained and supervised.
And I was in the Chicago Office Tower No.
US14 , the main hub for every Chicago-based company, where business workers would plug in every day (for the sake of the economy, some menial jobs were left to humans, but only about two percent).
I was pulled out of my daydreaming by another emotionless voice.
There was a whirring, then silence,
His fingers ran across the keyboard for a moment.
He stared quietly at the screen for a moment,
and then smiled, nodding to himself.
I watched him move the mouse,
and then clicking on internet explorer.
I watched the screen switch to yahoo,
as he sent whatever-it-was to himself.
I examined his face in silence.
There were deep bags beneath his eyes,
and, as he turned to me,
how deeply worn he was from the lines on his face.
With a jolt of shock, I realized
“Thank you,” he croaked, his throat thick with exhaustion.
Suddenly, in an unexpected movement, he hugged me.
Shocked, I stood still for a moment
as his eyes overflowed with tears.
Cynthia had died at exactly seven this morning.
Like I was just another thing.
Maybe I was just another unimportant thing.
The world would go on spinning
the metallic voice gave me: IL45094 .
I began twisting it in my mind, to occupy myself: I’ll for five o’
nine fours... For nine or five, four lies... ill too, to for-ti-five forty nine isles...
& I began spouting weird combinations of things like that, I’d get sidelong glances, raised eyebrows, contorted expressions.
My mind-twistings became verbal, ringing coldly off the windows.
I spun in a giddy circle, for a moment completely oblivious to my situation.
Until I heard sliding metal again.
I dropped to the floor, dizzy.
me scurried in, a long tape of figures in his hand.
We’ve never seen anything like it.”
Stovohobo's Ficlet Challenge the Fifth...No, Sixth?
Anyway, It's About Your Tag Cloud.
It’s been forever since I’ve done a challenge,
and I think it’s about time
that I started one up again.
on the “home” button, then look at “Your Library”.
If you’re like me, and you use a
fair amount of tags (or a fair amount of ficlets), you might have somewhere in the neighborhood of 2,500.
the tag page only shows as many tags
as it can hold (meaning, for me, just numbers and a’s).
characters, my list here can’t even go into the a’s:
with 666 Anyway, go onto that page
using those tags somewhere in the story.
My mom, naturally, was pretty freaked by the time
But Paige was by my side the whole time,
And she stayed there for the rest of the year.
She was out of money because
of the two plane tickets (she insisted on paying Angela back)
and she just couldn’t pay her morgage anymore.
welcomed her into our household with open arms.
Eventually, when I got up the nerve,
cried alot, and held onto me
I began writing about when Paige came
into my life, and she helped, writing down her own memories.
Paige never ceased to amaze me with her dogged
that it was all my doing,
Sure, I may have written most of it,
why it was fully completed, and why
But soon, we began recieving the letters.
from people all over the United States.
where you could send us personal stories, bios, etc,
or just talk to us and the other people about everything.
She named the website after our book:
We are both attending Nebraska State
Paige, I’ve never had a closer friend.
Through the years, I’ve managed to learn more about her past,
now that I have the strength to face it.
So many happy times I spent with Drew
as the years progressed from that
turbulent time in our Senior year.
as I look into Drew’s light face,
ever that dark, depressed boy who wore nothing but black
and listened to the same song over and over again.
just how much he’s changed me.
ever talks about is how I’ve changed him.
we had that vibrant sort of romance my new college
that ever since I found him
waiting for me Christmas Eve night.
even if he doesn’t declare it constantly,
way to make huge, public displays of it.
Actually, a few of our friends don’t even know we’re dating.
matters, because all that does matter
